title: Can switching Smite upgrades for free be a thing again now that Trailblazer is gone?
body:
http://i.imgur.com/DKF7k67.png
We can switch between the Hydras for free, why not Smite upgrades? I remember way back near the beginning of Season 5 we could switch between upgrades before buying the gem upgrades for free but that was too OP because Trailblazer existed. They had to tack a price onto it because people would buy Trailblazer initially for the sustain then switch upgrades for free. This is no longer an issue however since they removed Trailblazer. Since the problem is removed, why does it still cost a couple hundred gold to switch?

On a similar note, it'd be cool to be able to switch smite upgrades after the gem upgrades too, it's not often that you'd actually need to switch but this  but then how often do you actually need to switch Hydras?

No, he actually has a point. The NA casters mentioned a hidden benefit of the "switch" as well - the Titanic actually has a better build path than the Ravenous. 

The Jaurim's fist + Ruby Crystal is worth 1325 gold with no stacks, 1725 at max stats. The Vamp Scepter + Long Sword is worth 1250 gold. (And the Titanic has a 700 combine cost compared to the 1050 of Ravenous, allowing you to back and buy with more frequency with smaller powerspikes instead of a huge powerspike after sitting on a bunch of gold.) However, the Titanic is worth 3250 in gold while the Ravenous is worth 3375 (both without passive or active included). 

Its an objectively smarter decision to build up the Titanic then switch once the full item is built. The Trailblazer didnt even have that type of onesided advantage - Trailblazer was only the better buy if you couldnt use chilling/challenging smite to secure a kill.

As much as I would like for this to happen, here's what's going to keep it in my dreams instead of being a reality:
I start off with chilling smite for my early ganks,
Mid game/farming time swap to warding smite to keep on top of objective control, then when teamfights hit just back for challenging smite. If you need vision control of your own jungle just back swap ward and swap back. Not to mention junglers being forced into ward mules like supports, "Just back and swap we want vision everywhere but we don't want to upgrade our trinkets or palce a single ward ourselves, you can swap again right after".

They done with it on the Jungle items because, at the time. Swapping between Smites, didn't make the game interesting. You always started with Trailblazer because that gave you the best clears, and only prior to completing your item you always swapped to either challenging smite, or chilling smite.

That said, I'm not sure how Hydra is any different. Titanic hydra basically has a better Build path than Ravenous, and yet, it doesn't mean anything since you can swap them without considering the build path.
